programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 2 Montreal Mayor, Valérie Plante is committed to improving mobility and housing, the economy and the environment: how to stay on track? The collective group Espaces is developing a project for rural living together. Madeleine Féquière is launching the Black Opportunity Fund. Isabelle Kaliaguine, alias Dr Guenille, cares for clothes. Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc:
Finland-Russia: the end of neutrality
Sharing a border with Vladimir Putin's Russia, Finland has long cultivated its neutrality, until the war in Ukraine forced it to take sides. A look back over the turbulent history of this Scandinavian country, surrounded by Sweden to the west and Russia to the east.
Presented by: Émilie Aubry.

programme.title: Sur les sentiers de l'histoire
programme.desc: The Renaissance in the Loire Valley The Loire Valley has a deep and enduring connection with the French Renaissance. Known throughout the world for its prestigious châteaux, its dense forests and the River Loire itself, often described as France's only major untamed river, the Loire Valley is also a pillar of contemporary history. Directed by: Denis Dommel (France, 2019)

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
En-route for the Gras de Douarnenez
With five days of festivities the Gras de Douarnenez is a carnival on a grand scale! One of the last in Brittany or even in France, this fabulous celebration, open to everyone and every age, sees the entire town dress up and enjoy a chance to laugh at absolutely anything. Report by: Nina Montagné.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Un si grand soleil
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Mont Blanc: the secrets of Europe's highest summit
Mont Blanc, towering to over 4,800 metres above sea-level, remained unclimbed until 1786, date of its first ascent. Who were the first to reach its peak? Is it French or Italian? Can its famous glacier, the Mer de Glace, be saved? Join us on the roof of Europe...
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Le bonheur de vous plaire
programme.desc: To mark the 400th anniversary of Molière's birth, actors adopt the character of Tartuffe, a multifaceted, greedy and mischievous crook. Based on a single scene from Moliere's famous work, they question his sense of comedy. A behind the scenes immersion in "Vous toussez fort, Madame!", the play by Matthias Urban. Directed by: Géraldine Rod (Switzerland, 2022)

programme.title: Les petites bulles
programme.desc: Electricity in every shape and form During an afternoon at the French Museum of Scientific History, Maha Zein, cultural interpreter, invites us to discover the mysteries of electricity through its history.

programme.title: Massi en mission
programme.sub-title: Vrai ou faux : le vrai et le faux dans la science-fiction
programme.desc: The astronaut David Saint-Jacques challenges the YouTuber Massi Mahiou to prepare for a future space mission. But how exactly do astronauts train? What sort of experiments do they carry out? How do they live with zero gravity? Massi discovers all he needs to know about the mission and about space.

Whales
Rocky and Lily are heading off on a fabulous journey beneath the ocean waves, to meet the amazing blue whales and learn more about this protected species.
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc:
The Cévennes, back to nature
The Cévennes, a land that has all you could wish for. This unspoilt region covers four mountain massifs: Mont Lozère, the Causse-Méjean limestone plateau, the Cévenole valleys and Mont Aigoual. Of France's eleven national parks, it is the only one that's inhabited, offering remarkable landscapes shaped by man and nature.
Presented by: Ismaël Khelifa. Directed by: Damien Pourageaux (season 15, France, 2021)

programme.title: Délice Paloma
programme.desc:
Need a building permit? An escort? Mrs Aldjéria can sort it out for you. The woman who named herself after the country will stop at nothing to survive in today's Algeria. Her beautiful, unscrupulous young recruits help her increase her influence, and one girl, Paloma, is a particular favourite...

Directed by: Nadir Moknèche (France/Algeria, 2006)

Cast: Biyouna, Aylin Prandi, Lyes Salem

Genre: Dramedy

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 9: On every roof
Léon and Florence are now officially an item, but Léon isn't as demonstrative as his girlfriend would like. Francis helps Léon to track down Violette.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 10: Put yourself in my shoes
As Léon writes to Violette to try to persuade her to meet him, Julietta informs Ricardo that her biological father wants to get back in touch with him.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 11: That little grain
Florence's health has deteriorated, and Léon is worried. Doris and Ricardo are getting closer, thanks to Francis's old game console.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 12: Blue to the ceiling
Florence is still in hospital and makes Léon understand that she needs him to give her more space. Meanwhile, he has his own problems with Ricardo and the tension between them is rising.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Six degrés
programme.desc:
Episode 13: Happy Christmas!
Léon is safe and sound, to Florence and Ricardo's delight. The latter joins Bernard for the meeting with Violette and hopes to persuade her to talk to Léon.
Directed by: Hervé Baillargeon (Canada, 2021) Cast: Noah Parker (Léon), Francesca Barcenas (Julietta), Alexandre Goyette (Francis), Anthony Therrien (Ricardo), Catherine Trudeau (Marianne), Amaryllis Tremblay (Florence), Léanne Désilets (Doris)

programme.title: Un opéra pour un empire
programme.desc: Famous for its ghost, Opéra Garnier was a titanic construction project and showcase for the Second Empire. From 1852 to 1870, Paris became the capital of modernity. Behind the scenes, machinery, architectural details and legends, we look back at the building of the opera house designed by Charles Garnier. Directed by: Patrick Cabouat (France, 2020)
